toast.rubidium_toolkit.title: Rubidium Toolkit
toast.rubidium_toolkit.acknowledge_mod: The mod is allowed by this server
command.rubidium_toolkit.client.config_p: Config has been reset to preset %s!
rubidium_toolkit.tools.option.name: Tools
rubidium_toolkit.zoom.option.name: Zoom
rubidium_toolkit.dynlights.options.name: Dynamic Lights
rubidium_toolkit.tools.max_entity_distan: Hides and does not tick entities beyond this many blocks. Huge performance increase, especially around modded farms.
rubidium_toolkit.tools.vertical_entity_d: Hides and does not tick entities underneath this many blocks, improving performance above caves. This should ideally be set lower than the horizontal distance.
rubidium_toolkit.tools.max_block_distanc: Hides block entities beyond this many blocks. Huge performance increase, especially around lots of modded machines.
rubidium_toolkit.tools.vertical_block_di: Hides block entities underneath this many blocks, improving performance above caves (if you have your machines in caves, for some reason). This should ideally be set lower than the horizontal distance.
Reduces the mouse sensitivity when zooming.
rubidium_toolkit.zoom.scrolling.name: Zoom Scrolling
rubidium_toolkit.zoom.scrolling.tooltip: Allows using scroll wheel to adjust zoom amount.
rubidium_toolkit.zoom.transition.name: Zoom Transition Mode
rubidium_toolkit.zoom.transition.tooltip:
Controls how the game changes from normal to zoomed. Off will be an instant transition.
Off - disables transitions.
Smooth - replicates Vanilla's dynamic FOV.
Linear - removes the smoothiness
rubidium_toolkit.zoom.keybind.name: Zoom Keybind Mode
rubidium_toolkit.zoom.keybind.tooltip:
Hold - Zoom only while the key is down.
Toggle - Lock zoom until you press the key again
Persistent - Always zoom, if you want that, for some reason.
rubidium_toolkit.zoom.overlay.name: Zoom Overlay
rubidium_toolkit.zoom.overlay.tooltip:
Renders a vignette overlay when zooming.
- Vignette: uses a vignette as the overlay.
- Spyglass: uses the spyglass overlay with the vignette texture.

The vignette texture can be found at: assets/okzoomer/textures/misc/zoom_overlay.png
rubidium_toolkit.zoom.cinematic_camera.t:
Defines the cinematic camera while zooming. 
Off - disables the cinematic camera
Vanilla - uses Vanilla's cinematic camera.
Multiplied - a multiplied variant of Vanilla
rubidium_toolkit.zoom.allow_scrolling.to: Allows to increase or decrease zoom by scrolling.
rubidium_toolkit.zoom.extra_key_binds.to: Adds zoom manipulation keys along with the zoom key.
rubidium_toolkit.zoom.spyglass_dependenc:
Determines how the zoom will depend on the spyglass.
Require Item - will make zooming require a spyglass.
Replace Zoom - will replace spyglass's zoom with Ok Zoomer's zoom.
Both - will apply both options at the same time.

The Require Item option is configurable through the okzoomer:zoom_dependencies item tag.
rubidium_toolkit.zoom.disable_overlay_no: If the OkZoomer overlay should be disabled when the HUD is hidden. (F1 mode)
rubidium_toolkit.dynlights.speed.name: Dynamic Lights Speed
rubidium_toolkit.dynlights.speed.tooltip:
Controls how often dynamic lights will update. 


Lighting recalculation can be expensive, so slower values will give better performance. 


Off - Self explanatory 
Slow - Twice a second 
Fast - Five times a second 
Realtime - Every tick
rubidium_toolkit.dynlights.entity_lights:
Turning this on will show dynamic lighting on entities (dropped items, mobs, etc). 

This can drastically increase the amount of lighting updates, even when you're not holding a torch.
Turning this on will show dynamic lighting on tile entities (furnaces, modded machines, etc). 

This can drastically increase the amount of lighting updates, even when you're not holding a torch.
